summary:
Drummer/composer/producer/field recordist.
Born 1954, Lusaka, Zambia, British nationality, resident in Holland since he was 13.

From 1975-83 drummer in all Gijs Hendriks’ (NL) groups from trio to 12-piece band, with amongst others Slide Hampton (USA), Kenny Drew (USA), Raul Burnet (CUR), Sonny Grey (JAM), Siegfried Kessler (D), Joe Diorio (USA), Jan Akkerman (NL), Stan Tracey (GB), Kenny Wheeler (CAN).

Founded own label SWP Records in 1987. Led own group Sharp Wood from 1984-94. Other own groups: sextet Pygmees & Elephants in 1995, octet Utrecht Deep Artment in 1997-99, sextet Trendy 3D Junk in 2000-02, solo project Gongs And Bells in 2002-3, sextet African Abstractions in 2004-05, TranceMission in 2009, initiator Rhythm Orgy sessions 2008-11, Utrick City Impro Collective 2009-11, other projects and composition commissions.

Also played in André Jaume(F)/Jean-Marc Montera (F) Quintet, in Vogelvijf quintet led by Tjitze Vogel (NL), in Dick de Graaf (NL)/Serge Lazarevitch (F) Quartet, with pianist Arend Nijenhuis (NL), and in MOT sextet led by Steven Kamperman (NL).

In own groups played and recorded with amongst others: Broer van den Bogaart (NL), Hans Hasebos (NL), Albert Veenendaal (NL), Jogi Gillis (SUR), Michel Massot (B), Michiel Borstlap (NL), Ben Gerritsen (NL), David Tronzo (USA), Vitold Rek (PL), Michael Moore (USA), Michel Godard (F), Mark Lotz (D), Tjitze Vogel (NL), Paul Weiling (D), Konkie Halmeyer (CUR), Kofi Ayivor (GHA), Ousmane Seye (SEN), Jeroen van Vliet (NL), Zoumana Diarra (MAL), Rick van Heerden (ZIM), Kamal al Hors (MAR), Patrick Votrian (USA), Oké Sene (SEN), Layba Diawara (GUI), Mamour Seck (SEN), Lamin Kuyateh (GAM), Ebou Gaye Mada (GAM), Andy Moor (GB), Pino Basile (IT).

Compiled and produced the monumental 22-cd series 'Historical Recordings by Hugh Tracey' of African music from the 40s and 50s, released by SWP Records. Made own field recordings in Zambia, Zimbabwe, Lesotho, in 1996, 2002, '06, '08, '10, '14, '16, '18 - also released by SWP Records.

See also his Youtube channel CMBaird.

Made documentary film 'Mutanuka and Syasiya', completed in 2020, portraying two old master musicians of the Leya people in Zambia, who are the last on their respective instruments. Traditional music under threat from globalisation.

Specialties:  Honest cooking

profile_positions.description: Doing everything that has to be done - compiling cds, producing cds, mixing music recordings, mastering music recordings, remastering music recordings, composing music, performing music, finding lost music, making field recordings, writing texts to go with the music, making photos, selecting photos, creating the layout concept, promoting the finished product, doing the bookkeeping, remaining passionate.

profile_positions.description:
Playing jazz and latin music professionally since 1975. Started composing in 1985 and developing own style of music with his group Sharp Wood in 1986 - termed as 'Voodoo-jazz' by some German journalist many years ago. 
Doing his experiments: playing the drums, composing music, fiddling about with text, compiling cd albums, making audio recordings, mixing tracks.
Also started own independent label SWP Records in 1985 because of perceived lack of vision in existing record business. "SWP Records releases music that other labels won't touch. What's the matter with them? What's the matter with us?"
